p: The first autochthonous CHIKV epidemic in America and the Caribbean was reported on the island of Saint Martin at the end of 2013.[ 2] The Asian and Eastern/Central/Southern African CHIKV strains were the agents causing the epidemic outbreak.[ 3] In September 2014, the Colombian health surveillance authorities reported the first autochthonous CHIKV case. Three months later, the Colombian Caribbean region reported a generalized CHIKV outbreak.[ 6]
